name: HD 55696
scenarioDescription:
The HD 55696 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 55696 is a star with 1.29 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.52 times its radius. It is located 254.89 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.64 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 55696 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 55696 system


HD 55696 b

HD 55696 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 3.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 55696 b is 1230.66 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 55696 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 55696, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
